p: According to the CDC, the prevalence of CAP is highest among adults 65 to 79 years old ( 4). Hospitalization among adults is highest in elderly patients (≥ 65 yr) and those with preexisting obstructive lung disease or other cardiopulmonary disorders ( 4, 5). The most common cause of community- or hospital-acquired pneumonia in adults is viral with the most frequently detected pathogen being human rhinovirus, followed by influenza (9–15% and 4–6%, respectively) ( 4– 8). Other commonly detected causes of viral pneumonia include adenovirus, conventional coronaviruses, human metapneumovirus (HMPV), respiratory syncytial virus (RSV), and parainfluenza. The prevalence of viral respiratory illness is temporal in North America, with peaks of influenza, HMPV, and RSV normally seen in the winter months ( Table 1 ) ( 1).
